title: The Acrobatics of ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯
abstract:
Abstract
One can fix the randomness used by a randomized algorithm, but there is no analogous notion of fixing the quantumness used by a quantum algorithm. Underscoring this fundamental difference, we show that, in the black-box setting, the behavior of quantum
polynomial-time (ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯\mathsf{BQP}) can be remarkably decoupled from that of
classical complexity classes like ğ–­ğ–¯ğ–­ğ–¯\mathsf{NP}. Â Specifically:


â€¢

There exists an oracle relative to
which ğ–­ğ–¯ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯âŠ„ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯ğ–¯ğ–§not-subset-ofsuperscriptğ–­ğ–¯ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯superscriptğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯ğ–¯ğ–§\mathsf{NP}^{\mathsf{BQP}}\not\subset\mathsf{BQP}^{\mathsf{PH}}, resolving a 2005 problem of Fortnow.
As a corollary, there exists an oracle relative to which ğ–¯=ğ–­ğ–¯ğ–¯ğ–­ğ–¯\mathsf{P}=\mathsf{NP} but ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯â‰ ğ–°ğ–¢ğ–¬ğ– ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯ğ–°ğ–¢ğ–¬ğ– \mathsf{BQP}\neq\mathsf{QCMA}.



â€¢

Conversely, there exists an oracle relative to
which ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯ğ–­ğ–¯âŠ„ğ–¯ğ–§ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯not-subset-ofsuperscriptğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯ğ–­ğ–¯superscriptğ–¯ğ–§ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯\mathsf{BQP}^{\mathsf{NP}}\not\subset\mathsf{PH}^{\mathsf{BQP}}.



â€¢

Relative to a random oracle, ğ–¯ğ–¯=ğ–¯ğ—ˆğ—Œğ—ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯ğ–¯ğ–¯ğ–¯ğ—ˆğ—Œğ—ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯\mathsf{PP}=\mathsf{PostBQP} is not contained in the â€œğ–°ğ–¬ğ– ğ–°ğ–¬ğ– \mathsf{QMA} hierarchyâ€ ğ–°ğ–¬ğ– ğ–°ğ–¬ğ– ğ–°ğ–¬ğ– â‹¯superscriptğ–°ğ–¬ğ– superscriptğ–°ğ–¬ğ– superscriptğ–°ğ–¬ğ– â‹¯\mathsf{QMA}^{\mathsf{QMA}^{\mathsf{QMA}^{\cdots}}}.



â€¢

Relative to a random oracle, Î£k+1ğ–¯âŠ„ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯Î£kğ–¯not-subset-ofsuperscriptsubscriptsans-serif-Î£ğ‘˜1ğ–¯superscriptğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯superscriptsubscriptsans-serif-Î£ğ‘˜ğ–¯\mathsf{\Sigma}_{k+1}^{\mathsf{P}}\not\subset\mathsf{BQP}^{\mathsf{\Sigma}_{k}^{\mathsf{P}}} for every kğ‘˜k.



â€¢

There exists an oracle relative to which ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯=ğ–¯#â€‹ğ–¯ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯superscriptğ–¯#ğ–¯\mathsf{BQP}=\mathsf{P^{\#P}}Â and yet ğ–¯ğ–§ğ–¯ğ–§\mathsf{PH}Â is infinite. Â (By contrast, relative to all oracles, if
ğ–­ğ–¯âŠ†ğ–¡ğ–¯ğ–¯ğ–­ğ–¯ğ–¡ğ–¯ğ–¯\mathsf{NP}\subseteq\mathsf{BPP}, then ğ–¯ğ–§ğ–¯ğ–§\mathsf{PH}Â collapses.)



â€¢

There exists an oracle relative to which ğ–¯=ğ–­ğ–¯â‰ ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯=ğ–¯#â€‹ğ–¯ğ–¯ğ–­ğ–¯ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯superscriptğ–¯#ğ–¯\mathsf{P}=\mathsf{NP}\neq\mathsf{BQP}=\mathsf{P}^{\mathsf{\#P}}.



To achieve these results, we build on the 2018 achievement by Raz and Tal of an oracle relative to which ğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯âŠ„ğ–¯ğ–§not-subset-ofğ–¡ğ–°ğ–¯ğ–¯ğ–§\mathsf{BQP}\not\subset\mathsf{PH}, and associated results about the Forrelation problem. We also introduce new tools that might be of independent interest. These include a â€œquantum-awareâ€ version of the random restriction method, a concentration theorem for the block sensitivity of ğ– ğ–¢ğŸ¢superscriptğ– ğ–¢0\mathsf{AC^{0}} circuits, and a (provable) analogue of the Aaronson-Ambainis Conjecture for sparse oracles.
